Job Description(1 Year contract)

Description:
  • In this laboratory-based position, the candidate will join a group of scientists within the ImmunoPharmacology group to support the discovery and development of novel large and small molecule therapeutics targeting immunological diseases.
  • The individual will have primary responsibility for executing short-term and long-term pharmacology experiments.
  • The responsibilities will include evaluating pharmacological effects of test compounds in vivo pharmacology experiments, evaluating animal health, animal handling, dosing and collecting/processing tissue/blood for analysis.
Qualifications:
  • A high school diploma (with 3-5 yr of experience) / BS degree (1-2 yr of experience) in animal/biological sciences with training in animal research.
  • Hands-on experience with evaluation of animal health, animal handling, dosing, necropsy to collect tissues/blood of interest and preparing/processing laboratory samples for analysis.
  • Quantitative skills, familiarity with laboratory instrumentation, experimental documentation (digital and paper), basic data analysis/data management (Excel/ GraphPad Prism).
  • Interpersonal and organizational skills to execute experiments, detailed-orientated, skills to document and effectively communicate to stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with mouse models such as inflammation/autoimmunity/oncology and/or AALAC certifications (e.g. ALAT, LAT, LATG) is a plus.
Veterans are encouraged to apply!

Once your application is submitted and reviewed, a response will be initiated via a telephone call or email.
